'''Grovyle''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''ジュプトル''' ''Juptile'') is a {{type|Grass}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation III]].

It [[Evolution|evolves]] from {{p|Treecko}} starting at [[level]] 16 and evolves into {{p|Sceptile}} starting at level 36.

==Biology==
Grovyle is a bipedal Pokémon similar in appearance to a {{wp|Theropoda|theropod}} dinosaur. It is primarily green with a red underside. There is a belt-like green stripe across its belly. Grovyle's hands have two clawed fingers, and powerful legs with bird-like feet. Its well-developed muscles make it an expert climber and allow it to leap quickly from branch to branch. Grovyle has three long leaves on its wrists, a large leaf on top of its head, and two tails that have a leafy appearance. This leafy appearance allows it to be camouflaged in the {{DL|List of Pokémon by habitat|Forest Pokémon|forests}} where it lives. These leaves are also used in its former [[signature move]], {{m|Leaf Blade}}.

==In the anime==
===In the main series===
====Major appearances====
[[File:Sawyer Grovyle.png|thumb|left|250px|Grovyle in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
=====[[Ash's Grovyle]]=====
{{Ash}} caught {{p|Treecko}} in ''[[AG007|Tree's a Crowd]]''. It evolved into Grovyle in ''[[AG066|Exploud and Clear]]'', and in ''[[AG161|Odd Pokémon Out]]'', Grovyle later evolved into a Sceptile.

=====[[Grovyle (Explorers of Time, Darkness, and Sky)]]=====
Grovyle appeared in the [[SS020|anime adaption]] of [[Pokémon Mystery Dungeon: Explorers of Time and Explorers of Darkness]]. Despite having a large role in the games, he only appeared briefly in the beginning of the episode, stealing one of the [[Time Gears]]. He has a much bigger role in the [[SS021|Explorers of Sky special]].

=====[[Sawyer's Grovyle]]=====
A Grovyle appeared in ''[[XY075|Rivals: Today and Tomorrow!]]'', under the ownership of [[Sawyer]]. It evolved from a Treecko during a battle against {{Ash}} and his {{AP|Frogadier}}. It was later revealed to have evolved into a Sceptile before ''[[XY106|A Meeting of Two Journeys!]]''.

=====Other=====
Grovyle debuted in ''[[AG041|What You Seed is What You Get]]''. It was owned by a Pokémon Trainer named [[Natasha]] that works at a watermelon field. Natasha used her Grovyle along with her {{p|Slugma}} in a battle against [[Ash's Corphish]] and {{AP|Treecko}}. Working as a team, they were able to defeat Ash.

====Minor appearances====
A Grovyle was used by one of the participants of [[Pokémon Ping Pong Tournament]] in ''[[DP124|To Thine Own Pokémon Be True!]]''.

===In the Pokémon Omega Ruby and Alpha Sapphire Animated Trailer===
A Grovyle appeared in the [[Pokémon Omega Ruby and Pokémon Alpha Sapphire Animated Trailer]], under the ownership of {{ga|Brendan}}. It evolved from {{p|Treecko}}, and then eventually evolved into {{p|Sceptile}}, which was capable of [[Mega Evolution|Mega Evolving]].
{{-}}

==In the manga==
[[File:Wally Grovyle.png|thumb|200px|Grovyle in [[Pokémon Adventures]]]]
===In the Ash & Pikachu manga===
{{main|Ash's Grovyle}}
{{Ash}} also owns a Grovyle in [[Ash & Pikachu]].
[[File:Grovyle BET.png|thumb|left|200px|Grovyle in [[Pokémon Mystery Dungeon: Blazing Exploration Team]]]]
===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
{{main|Emerald's Sceptile}}
The Treecko meant to be handed to {{adv|Emerald}} was recovered by {{adv|Wally}} and became a Grovyle in ''[[PS241|Dreadful Dealing with Dusclops]]'' to rescue his temporary owner when a wild {{p|Dusclops}} threatened to suck them into its infinite cavity. After a few more weeks of training at the [[Sky Pillar]] under [[Norman]], he was able to awaken the ancient legendary Pokémon {{p|Rayquaza}}, but the huge gust of wind sent him flying miles away into a distant island where he evolved again to a Sceptile and was this time caught by [[Guile Hideout]], who smuggled him into the {{ho|Battle Factory}} to try to drive the nosy press away. He ended up being stolen by his legitimate owner, Emerald, and became a fixed member of his team.

Emerald had borrowed a Grovyle during his Factory challenge in ''[[PS306|Pinsir Me, I Must Be Dreaming]]'', it should not be confused with his Sceptile. This Grovyle, like the other Factory Pokémon, is at [[level]] 50.

===In the Pokémon Mystery Dungeon: Blazing Exploration Team manga===
{{OBP|Grovyle|Explorers of Time, Darkness, and Sky}} appeared in [[BET1]] and made subsequent appearances after that.

===In the Pokémon Omega Ruby Crimson Passion and Pokémon Alpha Sapphire Indigo Wisdom manga===
{{OBP|Alpha|CPIW}} owns a Grovyle.

==Game data==
===NPC appearances===
* [[Pokémon Mystery Dungeon: Explorers of Time and Explorers of Darkness|Pokémon Mystery Dungeon: Explorers of Time, Darkness]] and [[Pokémon Mystery Dungeon: Explorers of Sky|Sky]]: {{mdc|Grovyle|2}} is a major character in the main story line where he travels to the present to prevent the collapse of [[Temporal Tower]] by stealing Time Gears making him look like the bad guy. The {{player}} was his partner in the future. He also stars in the Special Episode [[In the Future of Darkness]].
* [[Pokémon Super Mystery Dungeon]]: The same Grovyle from Explorers of Time, Darkness, and Sky is recruitable via the Connection Orb. He requests assistance in rescuing {{mdc|Celebi|2}}.

==Trivia==
* Grovyle and its evolutionary relatives are the only Grass-type Pokémon that belong in the {{egg3|Dragon}}.

===Origin===
{{bulbanews|On the Origin of Species: Treecko, Grovyle and Sceptile}}
Appearance-wise, it resembles the dinosaur known as the ''{{wp|Dromaeosaurus}}''. It is believed that the dinosaur had feathers much like how Grovyle has leaves on its body. Its design could be based on a ''{{wp|Protarchaeopteryx}}''.

====Name origin====
Grovyle is a combination of ''grove'' (a group of trees) and ''reptile''. ''Vyle'' may also possibly refer to ''vine'' or ''vile''.

Juptile is based on ''jungle'' or 樹 ''ju'' (tree) and ''reptile'' or ''{{wp|Dromaeosauridae|raptor}}''.
